entities.description: "The Kremlin represents the government of Russia, which is involved in military actions against Ukraine."
"Kharkiv is Ukraine's second-largest city and has experienced bombardment, including the use of internationally banned cluster munitions, resulting in civilian casualties."
"Igor Terekhov is the mayor of Kharkiv, who expressed the severity of the situation in the city through a video posted on Facebook."
"The Ukrainian-Russian talks refer to diplomatic discussions between Ukraine and Russia, which ended with an agreement to meet again, indicating ongoing conflict."
"World War II is referenced as a comparison for the scale of the current military mobilization in Europe, highlighting its significance."
"Russian forces are conducting an invasion of Ukraine, shelling the outskirts of Kharkiv and causing civilian casualties."
"Ukraine is the country being invaded by Russia, with Kharkiv being one of its cities that has suffered from bombardment."
"The Russian assault refers to the military invasion launched by Russia against Ukraine, which includes the bombardment of Kharkiv."
"Afghans are the people who were airlifted out of Afghanistan last August, with many leaving behind personal belongings."
"Afghanistan is the country from which more than 120,000 people were airlifted out last August, due to the紧迫 situation."
"The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change is a body of experts convened by the United Nations that released a major report on the threats posed by global warming."
"The United Nations is the organization that convened the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change to assess the threats of global warming."
"António Guterres is the United Nations secretary general who commented on the report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change."
"Climate change is the ongoing process causing environmental threats such as floods, fires, and famine, as detailed in the report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change."
"The Environmental Protection Agency is the U.S. agency questioned by the Supreme Court regarding its ability to regulate carbon emissions from power plants."

"The Biden administration is the current U.S. government whose efforts to address climate change may be affected by the Supreme Court's questioning of the Environmental Protection Agency's authority."

relationships.description: "The Kremlin is responsible for the bombardment of Kharkiv, indicating a direct aggressive action against the city."
"Igor Terekhov is the mayor of Kharkiv, representing the city's leadership and speaking on behalf of its people during the crisis."
"The Kremlin is a party in the Ukrainian-Russian talks, which ended with an agreement to meet again, showing ongoing diplomatic efforts amidst conflict."
"Russian forces have been shelling Kharkiv, causing significant damage and loss of life in the city."
"Ukraine is the target of the Kremlin's military actions, indicating a conflict between the two entities."
"Afghans are the people airlifted out of Afghanistan, indicating a mass exodus from the country."
"The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change is convened by the United Nations to assess climate change threats."
"António Guterres commented on the report released by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change."
"The Environmental Protection Agency is part of the Biden administration's efforts to address climate change."

entities.description: "President of Russia, whose actions have led to sanctions and isolation of Moscow due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Capital of Russia, where the financial system is affected by sanctions imposed by the West in response to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Country invaded by Russia, leading to sanctions and a global response against Moscow."
"Group of countries imposing sanctions on Russia in retaliation for its invasion of Ukraine."
"National airline of Russia, which canceled all flights to Europe due to airspace bans imposed by European countries."
"Seat of the Russian government, which is affected by sanctions and is trying to manage the impact of the invasion of Ukraine."
"Owner of a small advertising agency in Moscow, expressing fear and uncertainty about her business due to the sanctions and the invasion of Ukraine."
"Country where Azaliya Idrisova plans to depart to, amidst the crisis caused by the Russian invasion of Ukraine."
"Company that is exiting all its joint ventures with Gazprom, RusSing Commerce and Culture, due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine."
"Russian energy company that is affected by the exit of Shell from joint ventures due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Russian entity affected by the exit of Shell from joint ventures due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Capital of Ukraine, where a children's hospital is mentioned in the context of the war."
"Second-largest city in Ukraine, which suffered a deadly rocket assault from Russia, raising alarms about the extent of the Kremlin's willingness to subjugate Ukraine."
"Nations that have banned Russian planes from using their airspace in response to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Cultural icon and conductor, who is a visible target of the worldwide repudiation against Russia due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Music festival in Switzerland that canceled concerts featuring a Russian maestro as a protest against the invasion of Ukraine."
"Sports team that boycotted a world championship meet in Russia due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Ski area in Vermont where a bartender poured bottles of Stolichnaya vodka down the drain as a protest against the invasion of Ukraine."
"Bank restricted by Western countries from accessing its foreign currency reserves due to the invasion of Ukraine."
"Conflict cited as an example of Russia's track record in brutal campaigns, which may be a precursor to its actions in Ukraine."
"Region in Russia where the government's ruthless efforts to crush separatism are mentioned as a sign of what might happen in Ukraine."
"First talks between Ukraine and Russia aimed at halting the invasion, which ended with little progress."

relationships.description: "Vladimir V. Putin is the President of Russia, leading the country from Moscow during the invasion of Ukraine."
"Moscow is the capital of Russia, which has invaded Ukraine, causing international sanctions and isolation."
"The West has imposed sanctions on Moscow in retaliation for Russia's invasion of Ukraine."
"Aeroflot, the national airline of Russia based in Moscow, canceled flights to Europe due to the sanctions."
"The Kremlin is attempting to subjugate Ukraine through military invasion."
"Azaliya Idrisova is a Moscow resident whose business is affected by the sanctions and the invasion of Ukraine."
"Shell is exiting all its joint ventures with Gazprom due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine."
"Kharkiv and Kyiv are both cities in Ukraine that are affected by the Russian invasion."
"European countries banned Aeroflot from using their airspace, leading to the cancellation of flights."
"Valery Gergiev, as a cultural icon, is associated with the Kremlin's actions and is targeted by the worldwide repudiation."
"Lucerne music festival canceled concerts as a protest against the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine."
"Australian national swim team boycotted a meet in Russia as a protest against the Kremlin's actions in Ukraine."
"A bartender at Magic Mountain Ski Area poured vodka down the drain as a protest against the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine."
"The Russian central bank's efforts to manage the ruble are undermined by the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine."
"The Syrian civil war is mentioned as an example of the Kremlin's track record in brutal campaigns."
"Efforts to crush separatism in Chechnya are cited as a sign of the Kremlin's potential actions in Ukraine."
"The Ukrainian-Russian talks are a diplomatic effort to halt the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine."
